summary: T Mark Flanagan was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents list Flanagan as part of the committee's staff from at least October 1977 through February 1979. The documents provide payroll and certification reports that include Flanagan's name, position, and salary during this period. While the specific role Flanagan held within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, their presence on multiple payroll and certification reports indicates a consistent involvement with the committee during its investigation.
significance: T Mark Flanagan's significance lies in their role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of their contribution is not detailed in these documents, their presence on payroll and certification reports indicates their involvement in the committee's operations.
